column4: Can anyone suggest how I troubleshoot the root partition not showing in df or mount in Edgy?  I've spent a long while googling and searching ubuntuforums and could do with some help!  More info at https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+ticket/2258
your /etc/mtab is out of sync with the real world
I know - however this is constant after each reboot and some things seem to depend on mtab
I don't know the details of that process, given that the root fs is usually mounted with -n I'm actually puzzled it *does* show up
OK - back to basics - does / show up in df on Edgy for anyone else?
Didn't know it was mounted with -n
Paddy - which version of Ubuntu are you using?
it is, because / is readonly at this point, which leads to mount failing because it writes the new mtab to a temp file first, then mounts, then renames
Thanks.  Any idea what else I can check/try?
you can always remount it again later
Thanks Anyway - anyone else got any ideas ? (df and mount missing root!)
- wouln't my sudo mount -a attempt to remount it?
OK - GyrosGeier - if I try sudo mount  -t ext3 /dev/hda1 /   I get mount: /dev/hda1 already mounted or / busy
